tn.text: Nahum describes the destruction of Nineveh in poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"A message from God about the City of Nineveh."
A person from the village of Elkosh (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of God that he revealed to his people in the Old Testament. See the translationWord page about Yahweh concerning how to translate this.

tn.ref: he will by no means declare his enemies innocent
tn.text: This means that Yahweh will judge and punish his enemies when they disobey him.

tn.ref: makes his way in the whirlwind and the storm
tn.text: Like the strong wind and storm, Yahweh moves with power. Alternate translation: "comes in power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]).
"the dust that his feet kick up"
Nahum continues to describe the power of Yahweh over the whole world.

tn.ref: The mountains shake in his presence, and the hills melt; the earth collapses in his presence
tn.text: AT: "The mountains, the hills, and even the earth are afraid of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
like a person who is afraid
"falls to the ground in fear"
Nahum speaking about Yahweh's power
"intensity of his anger" or "amount of his anger"

tn.ref: His wrath is poured out like fire, and the rocks are broken apart by him
tn.text: Alternate translation: "He pours out his anger like fire and breaks rocks apart." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
a safe place built for protection against enemies (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
when the enemy attacks. Alternate translation: "when bad things happen"
Nahum tells the people of Nineveh how Yahweh will deal with them.

tn.ref: make a full end to it
tn.text: "completely stop what you do"

tn.ref: trouble will not rise up a second time
tn.text: AT: "He will not attack you a second time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Nahum speaks briefly to the Israelites about the people of Nineveh.
"face many problems that will prevent them from attacking" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]).
Yahweh will totally destroy Nineveh (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
encouraged people to do wicked things
Yahweh speaks to the Israelites about Nineveh.
the people of Nineveh

"They will be cut off." Yahweh uses the image of cutting the wool off of sheep to show how he will cut away the army of Nineveh, even though they are many. AT: "they will be destroyed." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: break that people's yoke from off you
tn.text: AT: "set you free from slavery to those people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"break the chains with which they bound you as slaves"

tn.ref: on the mountains there are the feet of someone who is bringing good news
tn.text: "someone is bringing good news" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Nahum refers to the Ninevites as though they were one person.
Nahum is speaking of a future event as though it has already happened.
